article:
2023 Stanley Cup playoffs

The 2023 Stanley Cup playoffs were the playoff tournament of the National Hockey League (NHL) for the 2022-23 season. The playoffs began on April 17, 2023, and concluded on June 13, 2023, with the Vegas Golden Knights defeating the Florida Panthers in the Stanley Cup Finals, four games to one.

Playoff seeds

The top three teams in each division qualified for the playoffs, with the next two teams in the conference qualifying as wild cards.

### Eastern Conference

#### Atlantic Division

* (A1) Boston Bruins - 135 points
* (A2) Toronto Maple Leafs - 111 points
* (A3) Tampa Bay Lightning - 98 points

#### Metropolitan Division

* (M1) Carolina Hurricanes - 113 points
* (M2) New Jersey Devils - 107 points
* (M3) New York Rangers - 104 points

#### Wild cards

* (WC1) New York Islanders - 93 points
* (WC2) Florida Panthers - 92 points

### Western Conference

#### Central Division

* (C1) Colorado Avalanche - 112 points
* (C2) Dallas Stars - 108 points
* (C3) Minnesota Wild - 103 points

#### Pacific Division

* (P1) Vegas Golden Knights - 111 points
* (P2) Edmonton Oilers - 109 points
* (P3) Los Angeles Kings - 104 points

#### Wild cards

* (WC1) Seattle Kraken - 100 points
* (WC2) Winnipeg Jets - 95 points

Map of playoff teams

A map of the playoff teams, showing their locations and conference affiliations.

Playoff bracket

The playoff bracket was a best-of-seven series, with the winners advancing to the next round and the losers being eliminated.

First round

### Eastern Conference first round

#### (A1) Boston Bruins vs. (WC2) Florida Panthers

The Bruins won the series 4-2, with the Panthers' Aleksander Barkov scoring a series-high 7 points.

#### (A2) Toronto Maple Leafs vs. (A3) Tampa Bay Lightning

The Maple Leafs won the series 4-2, with the Lightning's Nikita Kucherov scoring a series-high 6 points.

#### (M1) Carolina Hurricanes vs. (WC1) New York Islanders

The Hurricanes won the series 4-2, with the Islanders' Mathew Barzal scoring a series-high 7 points.

#### (M2) New Jersey Devils vs. (M3) New York Rangers

The Devils won the series 4-3, with the Rangers' Artemi Panarin scoring a series-high 9 points.

### Western Conference first round

#### (C1) Colorado Avalanche vs. (WC1) Seattle Kraken

The Avalanche won the series 4-3, with the Kraken's Jared McCann scoring a series-high 7 points.

#### (C2) Dallas Stars vs. (C3) Minnesota Wild

The Stars won the series 4-2, with the Wild's Kirill Kaprizov scoring a series-high 6 points.

#### (P1) Vegas Golden Knights vs. (WC2) Winnipeg Jets

The Golden Knights won the series 4-2, with the Jets' Connor Hellebuyck scoring a series-high 2 shutouts.

#### (P2) Edmonton Oilers vs. (P3) Los Angeles Kings

The Oilers won the series 4-3, with the Kings' Anze Kopitar scoring a series-high 8 points.

Second round

### Eastern Conference second round

#### (A2) Toronto Maple Leafs vs. (WC2) Florida Panthers

The Panthers won the series 4-3, with the Maple Leafs' Auston Matthews scoring a series-high 7 points.

#### (M1) Carolina Hurricanes vs. (M2) New Jersey Devils

The Hurricanes won the series 4-2, with the Devils' Nico Hischier scoring a series-high 6 points.

### Western Conference second round

#### (C2) Dallas Stars vs. (WC1) Seattle Kraken

The Stars won the series 4-3, with the Kraken's Jordan Eberle scoring a series-high 7 points.

#### (P1) Vegas Golden Knights vs. (P2) Edmonton Oilers

The Golden Knights won the series 4-2, with the Oilers' Connor McDavid scoring a series-high 8 points.

Conference finals

### Eastern Conference final

#### (M1) Carolina Hurricanes vs. (WC2) Florida Panthers

The Panthers won the series 4-2, with the Hurricanes' Sebastian Aho scoring a series-high 7 points.

### Western Conference final

#### (P1) Vegas Golden Knights vs. (C2) Dallas Stars

The Golden Knights won the series 4-2, with the Stars' Jason Robertson scoring a series-high 6 points.

Stanley Cup Finals

The Vegas Golden Knights defeated the Florida Panthers in the Stanley Cup Finals, four games to one. The Golden Knights' Jack Eichel was named the Conn Smythe Trophy winner.

Player statistics

### Skaters

* Points: Connor McDavid (Edmonton Oilers) - 28
* Goals: Jack Eichel (Vegas Golden Knights) - 13
* Assists: Connor McDavid (Edmonton Oilers) - 19
* Plus/minus: Mark Stone (Vegas Golden Knights) - +14

### Goaltenders

* Wins: Logan Thompson (Vegas Golden Knights) - 12
* Goals against average: Logan Thompson (Vegas Golden Knights) - 2.29
* Save percentage: Logan Thompson (Vegas Golden Knights) - .922
* Shutouts: Connor Hellebuyck (Winnipeg Jets) - 2

Media

The 2023 Stanley Cup playoffs were broadcast on various networks, including ESPN, ABC, and NHL Network in the United States, and Sportsnet and CBC in Canada.

Notes

* The 2023 Stanley Cup playoffs were the first to feature the Seattle Kraken, who joined the NHL as an expansion team in 2021.
* The Vegas Golden Knights became the first team to win the Stanley Cup in their first season in the league since the 1927-28 New York Rangers.

References

External links

* 2023 Stanley Cup playoffs on NHL.com
* 2023 Stanley Cup playoffs on ESPN.com

article:
Dost Mohammad Khan
================

Dost Mohammad Khan (1793-1863) was the Emir of Afghanistan from 1823 to 1839 and again from 1842 to 1863. He is considered one of the most important figures in Afghan history, playing a crucial role in the country's relations with European powers and its internal development.

Background and rise to power
---------------------------

Dost Mohammad Khan was born in 1793 in Kandahar, Afghanistan. He was a member of the Barakzai tribe, which had been a dominant force in Afghan politics for centuries. Dost Mohammad's family had a long history of involvement in Afghan politics, with his father, Payinda Khan, serving as a powerful tribal leader.

Dost Mohammad Khan's rise to power began in the early 19th century, when he became involved in the struggles for control of Afghanistan. In 1823, he seized power in Kabul, becoming the Emir of Afghanistan. His early years in power were marked by struggles against rival claimants to the throne and against the Sikh Empire, which had been expanding its territories in the region.

European influence in Afghanistan
--------------------------------

During Dost Mohammad Khan's reign, Afghanistan became increasingly drawn into the orbit of European powers. The British Empire, in particular, was expanding its influence in the region, and Dost Mohammad Khan saw the need to establish good relations with the British in order to counterbalance the growing power of the Sikh Empire.

In 1838, Dost Mohammad Khan negotiated a treaty with the British, which recognized his sovereignty over Afghanistan and provided for British support in the event of an attack by the Sikhs. However, the treaty also contained clauses that limited Afghan independence, and Dost Mohammad Khan soon became disillusioned with the agreement.

War with the Sikhs
-----------------

In 1839, Dost Mohammad Khan launched a war against the Sikh Empire, seeking to expand his territories and assert his independence. The war was sparked by a dispute over the city of Peshawar, which was controlled by the Sikhs but claimed by the Afghans.

The war was a disaster for the Afghans, and Dost Mohammad Khan was forced to flee Kabul. The British, who had been supporting the Sikhs, installed a new ruler in Kabul, Shah Shuja Durrani. However, Shah Shuja Durrani's reign was short-lived, and he was eventually overthrown and killed.

Second reign
------------

Dost Mohammad Khan regained power in Afghanistan in 1842, following a series of revolts against the British-backed government. He established a new government and set about rebuilding the country, which had been devastated by the wars with the Sikhs and the British.

### Conquest of the Balkh Wilayat

One of Dost Mohammad Khan's first priorities was to reconquer the Balkh Wilayat, a region in northern Afghanistan that had been lost to the Sikhs during the war. In 1845, he launched a successful campaign against the Sikhs, and the Balkh Wilayat was returned to Afghan control.

### Alliance with the British

Despite his earlier conflicts with the British, Dost Mohammad Khan recognized the need to establish good relations with the British in order to counterbalance the growing power of the Sikh Empire. In 1855, he signed a new treaty with the British, which recognized Afghan independence and provided for British support in the event of an attack by the Sikhs.

### Conquest of Herat and Death

In 1862, Dost Mohammad Khan launched a campaign against the city of Herat, which was controlled by a rival claimant to the throne. The campaign was successful, and Herat was returned to Afghan control. However, Dost Mohammad Khan died in 1863, before he could consolidate his gains.

article:
BTS
================

BTS, also known as the Bangtan Boys, is a South Korean boy band formed by Big Hit Entertainment in 2013. The group consists of seven members: RM, Jin, Suga, J-Hope, Jimin, V, and Jungkook. Known for their energetic live performances, thought-provoking lyrics, and eclectic musical style, BTS has become a global phenomenon, breaking cultural and linguistic barriers and inspiring a devoted fan base.

Name
-----

The name "BTS" is an acronym for the Korean phrase "" (Bangtan Sonyeondan), which translates to "Bulletproof Boy Scouts." The name represents the group's desire to protect their fans from the harsh realities of the world and to be a source of comfort and inspiration.

History
-------

### 2010–2014: Formation and early years

BTS was formed by Big Hit Entertainment in 2010, with RM, Jin, and Suga being the first members to join the group. Over the next few years, J-Hope, Jimin, V, and Jungkook were added to the lineup. The group trained extensively, honing their skills in singing, rapping, and dancing. In 2013, BTS released their debut single, "No More Dream," which marked the beginning of their musical journey.

### 2014–2017

#### Skool Luv Affair and first concert tour

In February 2014, BTS released their debut EP, "Skool Luv Affair," which was a moderate success. The group's first concert tour, "2014 BTS Live Trilogy Episode II: The Red Bullet," took place in October 2014 and featured performances in South Korea, Japan, and the United States.

#### Mainstream breakthrough and commercial success

BTS's breakthrough came in 2015 with the release of their EP, "The Most Beautiful Moment in Life, Part 1." The album's lead single, "I Need U," was a hit, and the group's popularity began to grow exponentially. The group's subsequent releases, including "The Most Beautiful Moment in Life, Part 2" and "Wings," solidified their position as one of the leading K-pop groups in the industry.

#### You Never Walk Alone and Love Yourself: Her

In February 2017, BTS released their album "You Never Walk Alone," which included the hit singles "Spring Day" and "Not Today." The group's subsequent release, "Love Yourself: Her," was a critical and commercial success, and featured the hit single "DNA."

### 2018–2020

#### Love Yourself album series

In 2018, BTS released the album "Love Yourself: Tear," which featured the hit single "Fake Love." The group's subsequent release, "Love Yourself: Answer," was a compilation album that included tracks from the previous two albums, as well as several new songs.

#### Map of the Soul: Persona, stadium world tour and BTS World

In April 2019, BTS released their album "Map of the Soul: Persona," which featured the hit single "Boy With Luv" (feat. Halsey). The group embarked on a stadium world tour, "BTS World Tour: Love Yourself: Speak Yourself," which took place in May and June 2019. The tour featured performances in the United States, Europe, and Asia. In June 2019, the group released a mobile game, "BTS World," which allowed fans to interact with the group in a virtual environment.

#### Map of the Soul: 7, "Dynamite" and Be

In February 2020, BTS released their album "Map of the Soul: 7," which featured the hit single "On." The group's subsequent release, "Dynamite," was a disco-pop single that became a global hit. In November 2020, the group released their album "Be," which featured the hit single "Life Goes On."

### 2021–present

#### "Butter", "Permission to Dance" and Proof

In May 2021, BTS released their single "Butter," which became a global hit. The group's subsequent release, "Permission to Dance," was a collaboration with Ed Sheeran and was released in July 2021. In June 2022, the group released their anthology album "Proof," which featured a collection of tracks from throughout their career, as well as several new songs.

#### Military service and contract renewal

In 2022, several members of BTS began their mandatory military service, with Jin being the first to enlist in December 2022. The group's contract with Big Hit Entertainment was renewed in 2022, with the group signing a new contract that will keep them with the agency until 2028.

Artistry
---------

### Influences

BTS's music is influenced by a wide range of genres, including hip hop, rock, pop, and R&B. The group's members have cited artists such as Kendrick Lamar, The Beatles, and Queen as influences.

### Musical style

BTS's musical style is eclectic and experimental, incorporating elements of different genres and styles. The group's early music was heavily influenced by hip hop, but they have since incorporated elements of rock, pop, and electronic music into their sound.

### Lyrical themes

BTS's lyrics often focus on themes of love, self-empowerment, and social commentary. The group's music often addresses issues such as mental health, bullying, and social inequality.

Impact
-------

### Diplomacy

BTS has been recognized for their cultural diplomacy efforts, using their music to promote Korean culture and values around the world. The group has performed at numerous cultural events and has been recognized by the Korean government for their contributions to cultural diplomacy.

### Fandom

BTS's fan base, known as the "ARMY," is one of the most dedicated and passionate fan bases in the world. The group's fans have been recognized for their charitable efforts, raising money for a variety of causes and supporting social justice initiatives.

Other ventures
--------------

### Endorsements

BTS has partnered with numerous brands and companies, including Samsung, Coca-Cola, and Hyundai. The group has also partnered with fashion brands such as Gucci and Dior.

### Philanthropy

BTS has been involved in numerous charitable initiatives, including supporting education and healthcare programs in Korea and around the world. The group has also partnered with organizations such as UNICEF and the Red Cross.

Accolades
----------

BTS has received numerous awards and accolades throughout their career, including several Melon Music Awards, Mnet Asian Music Awards, and Billboard Music Awards.

Members
-------

* RM (Kim Nam-joon)
* Jin (Kim Seok-jin)
* Suga (Min Yoon-gi)
* J-Hope (Jung Ho-seok)
* Jimin (Park Ji-min)
* V (Kim Tae-hyung)

------------

article:
2022 NCAA Division I Women's Basketball Tournament

The 2022 NCAA Division I Women's Basketball Tournament was the 40th edition of the NCAA Division I Women's Basketball Championship, played from March 16 to April 3, 2022. The tournament field consisted of 68 teams, with the top four seeds in each of the four regions receiving a first-round bye. The tournament was won by the South Carolina Gamecocks, who defeated the UConn Huskies 64-49 in the championship game.

# Tournament procedure

The NCAA Division I Women's Basketball Tournament is a single-elimination tournament, with each team playing one game per round. The tournament is divided into four regions, each consisting of 16 teams. The top four seeds in each region receive a first-round bye, while the remaining 12 teams play each other in the first round. The winners of the first-round games advance to the second round, where they meet the top four seeds. The winners of the second-round games advance to the regional semifinals, also known as the Sweet 16. The winners of the regional semifinals advance to the regional finals, also known as the Elite Eight. The winners of the regional finals advance to the Final Four, where they compete in the national semifinals and championship game.

# 2022 NCAA tournament schedule and venues

The 2022 NCAA Division I Women's Basketball Tournament was played from March 16 to April 3, 2022. The tournament schedule was as follows:

* First Four: March 16-17
* First and second rounds: March 18-21
* Regional semifinals (Sweet 16): March 25-26
* Regional finals (Elite Eight): March 27-28
* Final Four: April 1-3

The tournament was played at 16 venues across the United States. The regional semifinals and finals were played at four venues:

* Greensboro Coliseum (Greensboro, North Carolina)
* Intrust Bank Arena (Wichita, Kansas)
* Spokane Veterans Memorial Arena (Spokane, Washington)
* Total Mortgage Arena (Bridgeport, Connecticut)

The Final Four was played at the Target Center in Minneapolis, Minnesota.

# Qualification and selection teams

A total of 68 teams qualified for the 2022 NCAA Division I Women's Basketball Tournament. The selection process was as follows:

## Automatic qualifiers

Thirty-two teams received automatic bids to the tournament by winning their conference tournaments. The conferences and their tournament champions were:

The following states received multiple bids to the tournament:

* California (4): Stanford, Gonzaga, UC Davis, Long Beach State

article:
Wednesday (TV series)

Wednesday is an American supernatural comedy-drama television series based on the character Wednesday Addams from The Addams Family. The series was created by Alfred Gough and Miles Millar, and it premiered on Netflix on November 23, 2022. The show has received widespread critical acclaim for its unique blend of dark humor, clever writing, and standout performances.

# Premise

The series follows Wednesday Addams, a brilliant and macabre teenager who is sent to Nevermore Academy, a boarding school for outcasts and supernatural creatures. As Wednesday navigates her new surroundings, she becomes embroiled in a mystery involving a series of murders and supernatural events. Along the way, she must confront her own dark past and the secrets that her family has kept hidden for years.

# Cast and characters

## Main

* Jenna Ortega as Wednesday Addams, a brilliant and macabre teenager who is the main protagonist of the series.
* Gwendoline Christie as Principal Larissa Weems, the principal of Nevermore Academy who becomes a mentor to Wednesday.
* Riki Lindhome as Valerie Kinbott, a teacher at Nevermore Academy who is initially at odds with Wednesday.
* Jamie McShane as Sheriff Donovan Galpin, a local sheriff who is investigating the murders at Nevermore Academy.
* Hunter Doohan as Tyler Galpin, the sheriff's son who becomes a love interest for Wednesday.
* Percy Hynes White as Xavier Thorpe, a student at Nevermore Academy who is initially a rival to Wednesday.
* Emma Myers as Enid Sinclair, a student at Nevermore Academy who becomes Wednesday's roommate and friend.
* Joy Sunday as Bianca Barclay, a student at Nevermore Academy who is a rival to Wednesday.
* Georgie Farmer as Ajax Petropolus, a student at Nevermore Academy who is a friend of Wednesday's.
* Naomi J. Ogawa as Yoko Tanaka, a student at Nevermore Academy who is a friend of Wednesday's.

## Recurring

* Luis Guzmán as Gomez Addams, Wednesday's father who is a loving but eccentric parent.
* Catherine Zeta-Jones as Morticia Addams, Wednesday's mother who is a strict but loving parent.
* Victor Dorobantu as Thing, the disembodied hand that serves as the Addams Family's butler.
* George Burcea as Lurch, the Addams Family's loyal butler.
* Tommie Earl Jenkins as Mayor Noble Walker, the mayor of the town where Nevermore Academy is located.

## Guest

* Christina Ricci as Marilyn Thornhill, a botany teacher at Nevermore Academy who has a mysterious past.
* Fred Armisen as Uncle Fester, Wednesday's uncle who is a eccentric and lovable character.
* Isaac Ordonez as Pugsley Addams, Wednesday's brother who is a mischievous and playful character.

# Episodes

## Season 1 (2022)

The first season of Wednesday premiered on Netflix on November 23, 2022, and consists of 8 episodes.

* "Wednesday's Child is Full of Woe" - The series premiere introduces us to Wednesday Addams, a brilliant and macabre teenager who is sent to Nevermore Academy.
* "Woe is the Loneliest Number" - Wednesday navigates her new surroundings at Nevermore Academy and becomes embroiled in a mystery involving a series of murders.
* "Friend or Woe" - Wednesday's roommate Enid Sinclair becomes a suspect in the murders, and Wednesday must clear her name.
* "Woe What a Night" - Wednesday's parents Gomez and Morticia visit Nevermore Academy, and Wednesday's dark past is revealed.
* "You Reap What You Woe" - Wednesday's rivalry with Bianca Barclay comes to a head, and the two engage in a series of pranks and one-upmanship.
* "Q & A" - Wednesday is interrogated by the sheriff about the murders, and she must use her cunning and intelligence to avoid suspicion.
* "If You Don't Woe Me, I'll Woe You" - Wednesday's love interest Tyler Galpin reveals a dark secret, and Wednesday must decide whether to pursue a relationship with him.
* "A Murder of Woes" - The season finale reveals the identity of the killer and the motives behind the murders.

## Season 2

The second season of Wednesday was announced in January 2023, and is expected to premiere in 2024. The season will consist of 8 episodes and will continue to follow Wednesday's adventures at Nevermore Academy.

# Production

## Development

The series was created by Alfred Gough and Miles Millar, who are known for their work on the TV series Smallville and Spider-Man 2. The two writers were fans of The Addams Family and wanted to create a series that would reimagine the characters for a modern audience.

## Casting

Jenna Ortega was cast as Wednesday Addams in May 2021, and the rest of the cast was announced in August 2021. The casting process was extensive, with the show's creators auditioning hundreds of actors for the various roles.

## Filming

Filming for the series took place in Romania and Bulgaria, and lasted for several months. The show's creators wanted to create a unique and atmospheric setting for the series, and chose to film on location in Eastern Europe.

## Music

The series features a unique and atmospheric soundtrack, which was composed by Danny Elfman and Chris Bacon. The music is a blend of dark and quirky themes, which perfectly capture the show's tone and atmosphere.

# Release

The series premiered on Netflix on November 23, 2022, and was released in over 190 countries worldwide. The show was a major hit for Netflix, and became one of the streaming service's most-watched original series.

# Reception

## Audience viewership

The series was a major hit with audiences, and became one of the most-watched original series on Netflix. The show's premiere episode was viewed by over 50 million households worldwide, and the series as a whole was viewed by over 200 million households.

## Critical response

The series received widespread critical acclaim, with many praising the show's unique blend of dark humor, clever writing, and standout performances. The show holds a 93% approval rating on Rotten Tomatoes, with many critics praising the show's originality and creativity.

## Accolades

The series was nominated for several awards, including the Golden Globe Award for Best Television Series - Musical or Comedy and the Screen Actors Guild Award for Outstanding Performance by an Ensemble in a Comedy Series.

# In popular culture

The series has had a major impact on popular culture, with many referencing the show's unique characters and themes. The show's influence can be seen in fashion, music, and film, and it has become a cultural phenomenon.

# Spin-off

A spin-off series is currently in development, which will follow the character of Enid Sinclair as she navigates her own supernatural adventures. The series is expected to premiere in 2024.

# Notes

The series is not part of the official Addams Family canon, but rather a reimagining of the characters for a modern audience. The show's creators worked closely with the estate of Charles Addams to ensure that the series stayed true to the spirit of the original characters.

2023 World Lacrosse Championship

The 2023 World Lacrosse Championship was the 14th edition of the international men's lacrosse tournament organized by World Lacrosse. The event took place from June 21 to July 1, 2023, in San Diego, California, USA. The championship featured 30 national teams competing in a series of pool play and playoff matches to determine the world champion.

# Hosting

The 2023 World Lacrosse Championship was hosted by the United States, with all games played at the Chula Vista Elite Athlete Training Center in San Diego, California. This marked the second time the USA hosted the World Lacrosse Championship, following the 1998 edition in Baltimore, Maryland.

# Participating nations

A total of 30 national teams participated in the 2023 World Lacrosse Championship. The teams were divided into six pools of five teams each for the pool play stage.

## Schedule

The 2023 World Lacrosse Championship schedule consisted of a round-robin pool play stage, followed by a playoff stage.

article:
Hurricane Nicole (2022)

Hurricane Nicole was a powerful tropical cyclone that brought significant impacts to the Caribbean and the southeastern United States in November 2022. The storm formed in the western Atlantic Ocean and rapidly intensified into a hurricane, making landfall in the Bahamas and later in Florida. Nicole's strong winds, heavy rainfall, and storm surge caused widespread damage and disruptions, particularly in the Bahamas and parts of Florida.

# Meteorological history

Hurricane Nicole originated from a tropical wave that emerged from the west coast of Africa on October 25, 2022. The wave moved westward across the Atlantic, gradually developing a closed circulation and convection. On November 2, the system was classified as a tropical depression, and by November 4, it had strengthened into Tropical Storm Nicole. Nicole continued to intensify, becoming a hurricane on November 5.

As Nicole moved northwestward, it encountered favorable environmental conditions, including warm ocean waters and low wind shear. The storm rapidly intensified, with its maximum sustained winds increasing from 70 mph (115 km/h) on November 5 to 120 mph (195 km/h) on November 7. Nicole's minimum central pressure dropped to 960 mbar (28.35 inHg) on November 7, making it a Category 3 hurricane on the Saffir-Simpson Hurricane Wind Scale.

# Preparations

As Nicole approached the Bahamas and the southeastern United States, governments and emergency management officials took steps to prepare for the storm's potential impacts.

## Bahamas

The Bahamian government issued a hurricane warning for the entire country, advising residents to seek shelter and stock up on supplies. The National Emergency Management Agency (NEMA) activated its emergency operations center and deployed personnel to assist with evacuations and relief efforts.

## United States

### Florida

The State of Florida declared a state of emergency, mobilizing resources and personnel to respond to the storm. Governor Ron DeSantis activated the Florida National Guard and deployed troops to support evacuation efforts and provide security. The Florida Department of Transportation suspended tolls on major highways to facilitate evacuations.

### Neighboring states

Georgia, South Carolina, and North Carolina also took precautions, declaring states of emergency and mobilizing resources to respond to potential impacts from Nicole.

# Impact

Hurricane Nicole brought significant impacts to the Caribbean and the southeastern United States.

## Lesser Antilles

Nicole passed north of the Lesser Antilles, bringing tropical storm-force winds and heavy rainfall to several islands. The storm caused power outages and minor damage, but no fatalities were reported.

## Greater Antilles

Nicole's outer rain bands brought heavy rainfall to Puerto Rico and the Dominican Republic, causing flash flooding and landslides. The storm's strong winds also caused power outages and minor damage.

## Bahamas

Nicole made landfall in the Bahamas on November 7, bringing Category 3 winds and a storm surge of up to 10 feet (3 meters). The storm caused widespread damage, particularly on the islands of Grand Bahama and Abaco. The Bahamas National Emergency Management Agency reported that over 1,000 homes were damaged or destroyed, and several major roads were impassable.

## United States

### Florida

Nicole made landfall in Florida on November 8, bringing Category 1 winds and a storm surge of up to 6 feet (1.8 meters). The storm caused widespread power outages, with over 300,000 households losing electricity. The Florida Department of Transportation reported that several major highways were closed due to flooding, and several bridges were damaged.

### Elsewhere

Nicole's outer rain bands brought heavy rainfall to Georgia, South Carolina, and North Carolina, causing flash flooding and minor damage. The storm's strong winds also caused power outages and minor damage.

## Canada

Nicole's remnants brought heavy rainfall to parts of Quebec and Ontario, causing flash flooding and minor damage.

# Aftermath

The aftermath of Hurricane Nicole saw widespread damage and disruptions, particularly in the Bahamas and parts of Florida.

Governments and emergency management officials worked to restore power, clear roads, and provide aid to affected residents. The Bahamian government established a relief fund to support affected residents, and the United States Federal Emergency Management Agency (FEMA) deployed personnel to support relief efforts in Florida.

article:
Lionel Messi
================

Lionel Andrés Messi Cuccittini is an Argentine professional footballer widely regarded as one of the greatest players of all time. Born on June 24, 1987, in Rosario, Argentina, Messi has consistently dominated the sport, winning numerous accolades and breaking records throughout his career.

Early Life
-----------

Messi was born to Jorge Messi, a steel factory worker, and Celia Cuccittini, a part-time cleaner. He grew up in a tight-knit family with two older brothers, Rodrigo and Matías, and a younger sister, María Sol. Messi's early life was marked by a passion for football, which was encouraged by his family. He began playing football at a young age, joining the local club Grandoli at the age of five.

Youth Career
------------

### Newell's Old Boys (1995–2000)

At the age of eight, Messi joined Newell's Old Boys, a local club in Rosario. During his time at Newell's, Messi played for the club's youth team, where he quickly made a name for himself as a talented young player. In 1998, Messi was diagnosed with a growth hormone deficiency, which required him to undergo treatment. Despite this setback, Messi continued to excel on the pitch, leading Newell's to several youth tournament victories.

### Barcelona (2000–2004)

In 2000, Messi's family moved to Barcelona, Spain, where he joined FC Barcelona's youth academy, La Masia. Messi quickly adapted to the new environment and began to make a name for himself as one of the top young players in the academy. During his time at La Masia, Messi played alongside other future stars, including Xavi and Andrés Iniesta.

Club Career
------------

### Barcelona (2004–2021)

#### 2004–2008: Rise to the first team

Messi made his professional debut for Barcelona in 2004, coming on as a substitute in a match against Espanyol. Over the next few years, Messi continued to impress, gradually becoming a regular member of the first team. In 2006, Messi helped Barcelona win the La Liga title, scoring seven goals in 26 appearances.

#### 2008–2012: Success under Pep Guardiola

In 2008, Pep Guardiola took over as manager of Barcelona, and Messi's career began to flourish. Under Guardiola's guidance, Messi developed into one of the world's top players, winning numerous titles, including three La Liga championships and two UEFA Champions League trophies. In 2010, Messi scored 34 goals in 35 appearances, helping Barcelona win the La Liga title and the UEFA Champions League.

#### 2012–2014: Record-breaking year and Messidependencia

In 2012, Messi broke numerous records, including the most goals scored in a calendar year, with 91 goals in 69 appearances. Messi's incredible form helped Barcelona win the La Liga title and the Copa del Rey. However, the team's reliance on Messi became a concern, with many critics arguing that Barcelona's success was too dependent on the Argentine's individual brilliance.

#### 2014–2017: Arrival of Luis Enrique and birth of MSN

In 2014, Luis Enrique took over as manager of Barcelona, and Messi continued to excel. The arrival of Luis Suárez and Neymar Jr. formed the deadly attacking trio MSN, which terrorized opposing defenses. In 2015, Messi helped Barcelona win the Treble, including the La Liga title, the Copa del Rey, and the UEFA Champions League.

#### 2017–2021: Final years at Barcelona

In 2017, Messi signed a new contract with Barcelona, making him one of the highest-paid players in the world. Over the next few years, Messi continued to play at an elite level, helping Barcelona win several titles, including two La Liga championships and one Copa del Rey. However, the team's decline in performance led to speculation about Messi's future at the club.

### Paris Saint-Germain (2021–2023)

In August 2021, Messi joined Paris Saint-Germain on a free transfer, signing a four-year contract. Messi's move to PSG marked a new chapter in his career, as he joined forces with other top players, including Kylian Mbappé and Neymar Jr.

### Inter Miami (2023–present)

In July 2023, Messi joined Inter Miami on a three-year contract, marking a new chapter in his career in Major League Soccer.

International Career
-------------------

Messi has been a key player for the Argentina national team, representing his country in numerous international tournaments. In 2008, Messi won the Olympic gold medal with Argentina, defeating Nigeria 1-0 in the final. Messi has also played in several World Cups, including the 2014 World Cup, where Argentina reached the final, only to lose to Germany.

Player Profile
--------------

### Style of play

Messi is known for his exceptional speed, skill, and vision on the pitch. He is a versatile player who can play in various positions, including as a winger, attacking midfielder, and striker. Messi's incredible dribbling skills and ability to beat defenders make him one of the most feared players in the world.

### Tactical positioning

Messi is often deployed as a left winger or attacking midfielder, where he can use his speed and skill to beat defenders and create scoring opportunities. However, Messi is also comfortable playing as a striker, where he can use his vision and passing ability to create chances for his teammates.

Reception
----------

### Comparisons with Cristiano Ronaldo

Messi and Cristiano Ronaldo have been compared and contrasted throughout their careers, with many fans and pundits debating who is the better player. While Ronaldo is known for his athleticism and finishing ability, Messi is revered for his creativity and vision on the pitch.

### Comparisons with Diego Maradona

Messi has often been compared to Argentine legend Diego Maradona, who is widely regarded as one of the greatest players of all time. Like Maradona, Messi is known for his exceptional skill, creativity, and leadership on the pitch.

In popular culture
-------------------

### Popularity

Messi is one of the most popular and marketable athletes in the world, with a massive following on social media. He has been featured in numerous advertising campaigns and has partnered with several major brands, including Adidas and Pepsi.

### Wealth and sponsorships

Messi is one of the highest-paid athletes in the world, with an estimated annual income of over $100 million. He has partnered with several major brands, including Adidas, Pepsi, and EA Sports, and has endorsement deals with several other companies.

### Philanthropy

Messi is known for his philanthropic efforts, particularly in his hometown of Rosario, Argentina. He has donated to several charities and has founded the Leo Messi Foundation, which supports education and healthcare initiatives.

### Public art

Messi has been the subject of several public art installations, including a statue in Rosario, Argentina, and a mural in Barcelona, Spain.

### Media

Messi has been featured in numerous media outlets, including newspapers, magazines, and television shows. He has also been the subject of several documentaries and has appeared in several films.

### Business ventures

Messi has invested in several business ventures, including a hotel chain and a clothing line. He has also partnered with several companies to launch his own line of products, including a line of sports equipment and a line of fragrances.

Personal life
-------------

### Family and relationships

Messi is married to Antonela Roccuzzo, whom he met in 2009. The couple has three children together, Thiago, Mateo, and Ciro.

### Tax fraud

In 2015, Messi was charged with tax fraud by the Spanish authorities, who alleged that he had failed to pay taxes on several endorsement deals. Messi was found guilty and sentenced to 21 months in prison, although he did not serve any time.

article:
Nathan Chen

Nathan Chen is an American figure skater who has dominated the sport with his exceptional technical skill and artistry. Born on May 5, 1999, in Salt Lake City, Utah, Chen began skating at the age of three and quickly rose through the ranks to become one of the most successful figure skaters in history.

#Early life and family

Chen was born to Chinese immigrant parents, Zhidong Chen and Mei Wang. His parents, both engineers, moved to the United States in the 1990s. Chen has two older sisters, Alice and Jane. He grew up in a family that valued education and encouraged his passion for figure skating.

Chen's family relocated to New York City when he was just a year old. He began skating at the Ice Theatre of New York City, where he was coached by his first coach, Peter Burrows. Chen's early years of skating were marked by his natural ability and dedication to the sport.

#Competitive skating career

##Early career

Chen's competitive career began at the age of six, when he entered his first local competition. He quickly made a name for himself in the juvenile and intermediate ranks, winning several regional and national titles.

##Junior career

In 2011, Chen won his first junior national title, which marked the beginning of his successful junior career. He went on to win two more junior national titles and represented the United States at several international competitions, including the Junior World Championships.

##Senior career

###2016–2017 season: Senior international debut, Four Continents title and first senior national title

Chen made his senior international debut at the 2016 Nebelhorn Trophy, where he won the gold medal. He went on to win his first senior national title at the 2017 U.S. Championships, defeating defending champion Adam Rippon.

###2017–2018 season: Pyeongchang Olympics and first World title

Chen's 2017-2018 season was marked by his historic performance at the Pyeongchang Olympics, where he became the first skater to land five quadruple jumps in a single program. Although he finished fifth in the individual event, he helped the United States win the bronze medal in the team event.

At the 2018 World Championships, Chen won his first World title, defeating two-time defending champion Yuzuru Hanyu of Japan.

###2018–2019 season: Second consecutive World title

Chen began the 2018-2019 season with a win at the 2018 Grand Prix of Figure Skating Final. He went on to win his second consecutive World title at the 2019 World Championships, defeating defending Olympic champion Hanyu.

###2019–2020 season: Third consecutive Grand Prix Final title

Chen's 2019-2020 season was marked by his third consecutive win at the Grand Prix of Figure Skating Final. He also won his fourth consecutive national title at the 2020 U.S. Championships.

###2020–2021 season: Third consecutive World title

At the 2021 World Championships, Chen won his third consecutive World title, defeating Yuma Kagiyama of Japan.

###2021–2022 season: Olympic gold medal

Chen's 2021-2022 season was marked by his historic performance at the Beijing Olympics, where he won the gold medal in the individual event. He became the first American man to win the gold medal since Evan Lysacek in 2010.

###2022–23, 2023-24, and 2024–25 seasons: Hiatus

After his Olympic victory, Chen announced that he would be taking a hiatus from competitive figure skating to focus on his education and personal life.

#Show-skating career

Chen has been involved in several show-skating projects, including the Stars on Ice tour and the Ice Theatre of New York City's annual galas.

##Coaching

Chen has worked with several coaches throughout his career, including Peter Burrows, Marina Zueva, and Igor Shpilband. He currently works with Rafal Arutyunyan, who has been his coach since 2015.

#Skating technique and style

Chen is known for his exceptional technical skill, which includes his ability to land quadruple jumps and execute complex footwork sequences. He is also praised for his artistry and musicality, which have been influenced by his training in ballet and modern dance.

article:
Founding Fathers of the United States

The Founding Fathers of the United States were a group of visionary individuals who played a crucial role in the formation and shaping of the United States. They were instrumental in the drafting and signing of the Declaration of Independence, the Articles of Confederation, and the United States Constitution. These men, along with several women, were key figures in the American Revolutionary War and the early years of the United States. This article explores the lives, contributions, and legacy of the Founding Fathers.

# Historical founders

The term "Founding Fathers" was first used in 1916 by Warren G. Harding in a speech. However, the concept of a group of founders has been around since the early days of the Republic. The historical founders of the United States were a diverse group of individuals who shared a common goal of creating a new nation based on democratic principles.

# Origin of phrase

The phrase "Founding Fathers" was coined by Warren G. Harding in a speech delivered on September 17, 1916, at the Republican National Convention. Harding used the term to describe the group of individuals who had played a crucial role in the formation of the United States. The phrase gained popularity over time and has since been widely used to refer to the group of individuals who were instrumental in the founding of the United States.

# List of Founding Fathers

## Framers and signers

The following individuals were signers of the Declaration of Independence, the Articles of Confederation, and the United States Constitution:

* John Adams
* Samuel Adams
* Josiah Bartlett
* Carter Braxton
* Charles Carroll
* Samuel Chase
* Abraham Clark
* George Clymer
* William Ellery
* William Floyd
* Benjamin Franklin
* Elbridge Gerry
* Button Gwinnett
* Lyman Hall
* John Hancock
* Benjamin Harrison
* John Hart
* Joseph Hewes
* Thomas Heyward Jr.
* William Hooper
* Stephen Hopkins
* Francis Hopkinson
* Samual Huntington
* Thomas Jefferson
* Richard Henry Lee
* John Morton
* Thomas Nelson Jr.
* William Paca
* Robert Treat Paine
* John Penn
* George Read
* Caesar Rodney
* George Ross
* Edward Rutledge
* Roger Sherman
* James Smith
* Richard Stockton
* Thomas Stone
* George Taylor
* Matthew Thornton
* George Walton
* William Whipple
* John Witherspoon
* Oliver Wolcott
* George Wythe

### Other delegates

In addition to the signers, there were several other delegates who played important roles in the Continental Congress:

* John Dickinson
* Benjamin Rush
* James Otis Jr.
* Patrick Henry
* George Mason
* James Madison

## Additional Founding Fathers

The following individuals were not signers of the Declaration of Independence or the United States Constitution but played important roles in the founding of the United States:

* George Washington
* John Jay
* Alexander Hamilton
* Thomas Paine
* Paul Revere
* Crispus Attucks

## Women founders

While women did not have the same level of involvement in the founding of the United States as men, there were several women who played important roles:

* Abigail Adams
* Deborah Read Franklin
* Betsy Ross
* Phyllis Wheatley

## Other patriots

There were many other individuals who played important roles in the American Revolutionary War and the early years of the United States:

* Nathan Hale
* John André
* Benedict Arnold
* Ethan Allen
* Daniel Boone

# The colonies unite (1765–1774)

The colonies began to unite in opposition to British rule in the mid-1760s. The Stamp Act, passed in 1765, was the first major tax imposed on the colonies by the British government. The act sparked widespread protests and boycotts, and the colonies began to work together to resist British rule.

# Continental Congress (1774–1775)

The Continental Congress was a gathering of delegates from the various colonies that met in Philadelphia in 1774. The Congress was called in response to the Intolerable Acts, a series of laws passed by the British government that further restricted the rights of the colonies.

## First Continental Congress (1774)

The First Continental Congress met from September 5 to October 26, 1774. The Congress issued a statement of grievances and called for a boycott of British goods.

## Second Continental Congress (1775)

The Second Continental Congress met from May 10 to December 1775. The Congress drafted the Declaration of Independence and began to organize a military resistance to British rule.

# Declaration of Independence (1776)

The Declaration of Independence was adopted by the Continental Congress on July 4, 1776. The document, written primarily by Thomas Jefferson, declared the colonies to be independent and free from British rule.

# Fighting for independence

The American Revolutionary War lasted from 1775 to 1783. The war was fought between the colonies and Great Britain, with the colonies ultimately emerging victorious.

## Treaty of Paris

The Treaty of Paris, signed in 1783, officially ended the American Revolutionary War and recognized the independence of the United States.

# Constitutional Convention

The Constitutional Convention was a gathering of delegates from the various states that met in Philadelphia in 1787. The Convention drafted the United States Constitution, which went into effect in 1789.

## Virginia and New Jersey plans

The Virginia Plan, proposed by James Madison, called for a strong central government with three branches. The New Jersey Plan, proposed by William Paterson, called for a weaker central government with more power given to the states.

## Connecticut Compromise

The Connecticut Compromise, also known as the Great Compromise, was a proposal that established a bicameral legislature with equal representation for each state in the Senate and proportional representation in the House of Representatives.

## State ratification conventions

The Constitution was ratified by the necessary number of states in 1788. The ratification process was completed in 1789, when the first Congress met under the new Constitution.

## New form of government

The United States Constitution established a new form of government, with a strong central government and a system of checks and balances.

## Bill of Rights

The Bill of Rights, the first ten amendments to the Constitution, was added in 1791. The Bill of Rights guaranteed certain individual freedoms and rights, such as the freedom of speech and the right to bear arms.

# Ascending to the presidency

George Washington was inaugurated as the first President of the United States in 1789. Washington set important precedents for the office of the presidency and established the foundation for the executive branch of government.

# Demographics and other characteristics

## Political experience

Many of the Founding Fathers had significant political experience before the American Revolution. They had served in colonial governments, the Continental Congress, and other offices.

## Education

### American institutions

Many of the Founding Fathers attended American institutions, such as Harvard College and the College of New Jersey (now Princeton University).

### British institutions

Some of the Founding Fathers attended British institutions, such as Oxford University and Cambridge University.

## Ethnicity

The Founding Fathers were primarily of English, Scottish, and Irish descent.

## Occupations

Many of the Founding Fathers were lawyers, merchants, and plantation owners.

# Religion

The Founding Fathers were primarily Christian, with many being Episcopalians, Presbyterians, and Congregationalists.

# Founders on currency and postage

Many of the Founding Fathers have been featured on United States currency and postage stamps.

# Political and cultural impact

## Political rhetoric

The Founding Fathers have had a lasting impact on American political rhetoric, with their ideas and phrases continuing to be used today.

## Holidays

The Founding Fathers are remembered on several holidays, including Independence Day and Presidents' Day.

## Media and theater

The Founding Fathers have been featured in numerous films, plays, and books, including the musical "1776" and the film "Hamilton."

## Sports

The Founding Fathers have been referenced in sports, with teams such as the Philadelphia 76ers and the Washington Nationals.

# Religious freedom

The Founding Fathers believed in the importance of religious freedom, with the First Amendment guaranteeing the right to free exercise of religion.

# Slavery

The Founding Fathers were divided on the issue of slavery, with some owning slaves and others opposing the institution.

## Reconstruction as a "Second Founding"

The Reconstruction Era following the Civil War has been referred to as a "Second Founding" of the United States, with the passage of the 13th, 14th, and 15th Amendments to the Constitution.

# Scholarly analysis

## Early historians

Early historians, such as George Bancroft and David Ramsay, wrote extensively about the Founding Fathers and the American Revolution.

## Modern historians

Modern historians, such as Gordon Wood and Joseph Ellis, have continued to study and write about the Founding Fathers and the American Revolution.

## Noted collections

Noted collections of documents and papers related to the Founding Fathers include the Library of Congress's American Memory collection and the National Archives' Founders Online collection.

* United States Constitution
* Declaration of Independence

# Notes

# Citations

# Bibliography

## Journal articles

* Bailyn, Bernard. "The Ideological Origins of the American Revolution." The William and Mary Quarterly, vol. 22, no. 2, 1965, pp. 175-196.
* Wood, Gordon S. "The Creation of the American Republic, 1776-1787." The William and Mary Quarterly, vol. 34, no. 4, 1977, pp. 549-564.

## Online sources

* "The Founding Fathers." National Archives, [www.archives.gov/founding-docs](http://www.archives.gov/founding-docs).
* "The Founders." Library of Congress, [www.loc.gov/collections/founding-fathers](http://www.loc.gov/collections/founding-fathers).

# Further reading

## Books

* Wood, Gordon S. The Creation of the American Republic, 1776-1787. University of North Carolina Press, 1998.
* Ellis, Joseph J. Founding Brothers: The Revolutionary Generation. Alfred A. Knopf, 2000.

## Journal articles

* Maier, Pauline. "The Logic of Liberty." The William and Mary Quarterly, vol. 62, no. 3, 2005, pp. 481-498.

# External links

* National Archives: Founders Online
* Library of Congress: American Memory
* U.S. Government Publishing Office: Founding Documents

article:
Tennis Pro Tours and Tournament Ranking Series

Tennis is one of the most popular individual sports in the world, with a huge global following and a calendar of events that spans the entire year. At the heart of professional tennis are the tours and tournament ranking series, which provide a framework for players to compete against each other and earn recognition and rewards for their performances. This article provides an overview of the main professional tours and tournament ranking series in tennis, including their history, winners, and notable features.

# World Championship Tours

The World Championship tours are the highest level of competition in professional tennis, featuring the best players from around the world. The two main tours are the Association of Tennis Professionals (ATP) Tour for men and the Women's Tennis Association (WTA) Tour for women.

## Winners

The winners of the World Championship tours are determined by a combination of factors, including the number of titles won, the ranking points earned, and the prize money awarded. The most successful players on the ATP Tour include Novak Djokovic, Roger Federer, and Rafael Nadal, who have dominated the sport for over a decade. On the WTA Tour, the top winners include Serena Williams, Steffi Graf, and Martina Navratilova.

The ATP Tour and WTA Tour each have a season-ending championship tournament, which brings together the top players from each tour to compete for a grand prize. The ATP Finals and WTA Finals are considered to be among the most prestigious events in tennis, and are watched by millions of fans around the world.

# Tournament Ranking Series

The tournament ranking series is a system used to rank tennis players based on their performances in different tournaments. The two main ranking series are the ATP Rankings and WTA Rankings, which are used to determine the top players in the world.

## Winners

The winners of the tournament ranking series are determined by a combination of factors, including the number of titles won, the ranking points earned, and the prize money awarded. The most successful players in the ATP Rankings include Novak Djokovic, Roger Federer, and Rafael Nadal, who have held the number one ranking for a record number of weeks. On the WTA Rankings, the top winners include Serena Williams, Steffi Graf, and Martina Navratilova.

The tournament ranking series is used to determine the seedings for Grand Slam tournaments and other major events, and is also used to determine the qualification for the ATP Finals and WTA Finals.

# Other Professional Tours

In addition to the ATP Tour and WTA Tour, there are several other professional tours that provide opportunities for players to compete and develop their skills.

## Women

The International Tennis Federation (ITF) Women's Circuit is a series of tournaments that provides a stepping stone for players to move up to the WTA Tour. The ITF Women's Circuit features a range of events, from small tournaments with modest prize money to larger events that attract top players.

The Women's Professional Tennis Association (WPTA) is a new tour that was launched in 2020, which aims to provide more opportunities for women players to compete and earn a living from tennis. The WPTA features a range of events, including singles and doubles tournaments, and has attracted a number of top players.

## Men

The ATP Challenger Tour is a series of tournaments that provides a stepping stone for players to move up to the ATP Tour. The ATP Challenger Tour features a range of events, from small tournaments with modest prize money to larger events that attract top players.

The ITF Men's Circuit is a series of tournaments that provides a stepping stone for players to move up to the ATP Tour. The ITF Men's Circuit features a range of events, from small tournaments with modest prize money to larger events that attract top players.

# See also

* List of tennis tournaments
* Grand Slam (tennis)
* ATP Tour
* WTA Tour
* ITF Men's Circuit
* ITF Women's Circuit

# Notes

This article provides a general overview of the main professional tours and tournament ranking series in tennis. For more detailed information, please refer to the relevant articles on each tour and ranking series.

# References

This article does not include any references or citations.

# Bibliography

This article does not include any bibliography.

# External links

* Women's Tennis Association (WTA)
* International Tennis Federation (ITF)
* Women's Professional Tennis Association (WPTA)

2023 UK Open
================

The 2023 UK Open is a professional darts tournament that took place from March 3-5, 2023, at the Butlin's Resort in Minehead, England. The event was the 21st edition of the UK Open, which is one of the major tournaments on the Professional Darts Corporation (PDC) calendar.

Prize Money
------------

The total prize money for the 2023 UK Open was £450,000, with the winner receiving £100,000. The prize money was distributed as follows:

* Winner: £100,000
* Runner-up: £50,000
* Semi-finalists: £25,000
* Quarter-finalists: £15,000
* Fifth round: £10,000
* Sixth round: £7,000
* Fourth round: £5,000
* Third round: £3,000
* Second round: £2,000

--------

article:
2023 Scottish National Party leadership election

The 2023 Scottish National Party leadership election was a leadership election held to determine the next leader of the Scottish National Party (SNP) and the First Minister of Scotland. The election was triggered by the resignation of Nicola Sturgeon as leader of the SNP and First Minister of Scotland on February 15, 2023.

#Background

Nicola Sturgeon had been the leader of the SNP and First Minister of Scotland since 2014. article:
Grant Wahl
================

Grant Wahl was an American sports journalist, best known for his work as a soccer correspondent for Fox Sports and Sports Illustrated. Throughout his career, Wahl covered numerous high-profile sporting events, including multiple FIFA World Cups and the Olympics. His in-depth reporting and commentary earned him a reputation as one of the leading voices in American soccer journalism.

Early Life and Education
-------------------------

Grant Wahl was born on December 29, 1973, in Mission, Kansas. Growing up in a sports-loving family, Wahl developed a passion for soccer from an early age. He attended Shawnee Mission East High School, where he played on the school soccer team. Wahl's interest in sports journalism began during his high school years, when he wrote for the school newspaper.

After graduating from high school, Wahl enrolled at Princeton University, where he studied history and played for the university's soccer team. During his time at Princeton, Wahl wrote for the university's student newspaper, The Daily Princetonian. He graduated from Princeton in 1996.

Career
--------

Wahl began his career in sports journalism in 1996, when he joined the sports department at The Miami Herald. During his time at The Miami Herald, Wahl covered a range of sports, including soccer, basketball, and football. In 1998, he moved to Sports Illustrated, where he became a senior writer and covered soccer, among other sports.

In 2012, Wahl joined Fox Sports as a soccer correspondent, where he covered numerous high-profile events, including the FIFA World Cup and the UEFA Champions League. Wahl's reporting and commentary were widely praised for their insight and expertise. He became a regular fixture on Fox Sports' soccer coverage, providing analysis and commentary on major tournaments.

Wahl was also a prominent voice on social media, where he engaged with fans and shared his opinions on the latest developments in the soccer world. His Twitter account, which had over 800,000 followers at the time of his death, was widely followed by soccer fans and journalists alike.

Personal Life
-------------

Wahl was married to Dr. Céline Gounder, a medical journalist and infectious disease specialist. The couple met in 2002 and were married in 2005. Wahl was known to be a devoted husband and supported his wife's work, often accompanying her to medical conferences and events.

Death
------

Grant Wahl died on December 9, 2022, while covering the 2022 FIFA World Cup in Qatar. He was 49 years old at the time of his death. Wahl collapsed during the match between Argentina and the Netherlands and was pronounced dead shortly after being taken to a local hospital. The cause of death was later determined to be an aortic aneurysm.

Wahl's death sent shockwaves through the soccer world, with tributes pouring in from fans, players, and fellow journalists. His wife, Céline, paid tribute to her husband, describing him as "a wonderful husband, a great friend, and a brilliant journalist."

Awards and Recognition
----------------------

Wahl received numerous awards and accolades for his work as a sports journalist. In 2014, he was named one of the top 10 sports media personalities by Sports Illustrated. Wahl was also a three-time winner of the North American Soccer Reporters' (NASR) award for best writer.

Books
------

Wahl wrote two books on soccer: "The Beckham Experiment" (2009), which chronicled David Beckham's move to Major League Soccer, and "Masters of Modern Soccer" (2018), which explored the tactics and strategies of the world's top soccer teams.

Super Bowl LVI
================

The Super Bowl LVI was the 56th edition of the Super Bowl, the annual championship game of the National Football League (NFL). The game was played on February 13, 2022, at SoFi Stadium in Inglewood, California. The Los Angeles Rams defeated the Cincinnati Bengals by a score of 23-20, capturing their second Super Bowl title in franchise history.

Background
----------

### Host selection process

The host selection process for Super Bowl LVI began in 2017, when the NFL announced that it would be accepting bids from potential host cities for the 2022 Super Bowl. The Los Angeles Rams, who had relocated to Los Angeles in 2016, submitted a bid to host the game at their new stadium, SoFi Stadium, which was under construction at the time. The bid was successful, and the NFL announced on May 23, 2017, that Los Angeles would host Super Bowl LVI.

### Impact of the COVID-19 pandemic

The COVID-19 pandemic had a significant impact on the planning and execution of Super Bowl LVI. The NFL and the Los Angeles Rams worked closely with local health officials to develop a comprehensive plan to ensure the safety of players, staff, and spectators. The plan included measures such as social distancing, mask-wearing, and vaccination requirements. Despite the challenges posed by the pandemic, the game was played without major incident.

Teams
-----

### Los Angeles Rams

The Los Angeles Rams entered the 2021 NFL season as one of the top contenders in the league. Led by quarterback Matthew Stafford, the team finished the regular season with a 12-5 record and won the NFC West division title. In the playoffs, the Rams defeated the Arizona Cardinals and the Tampa Bay Buccaneers to advance to the Super Bowl.

### Cincinnati Bengals

The Cincinnati Bengals entered the 2021 NFL season as a dark horse contender. Led by quarterback Joe Burrow, the team finished the regular season with a 10-7 record and won the AFC North division title. In the playoffs, the Bengals defeated the Las Vegas Raiders and the Kansas City Chiefs to advance to the Super Bowl.

### Playoffs

The playoffs for Super Bowl LVI were played in January 2022. The Los Angeles Rams and the Cincinnati Bengals both won their respective divisional playoff games to advance to the conference championship games. The Rams defeated the San Francisco 49ers in the NFC Championship Game, while the Bengals defeated the Kansas City Chiefs in the AFC Championship Game.

### Pre-game notes

In the days leading up to the game, there was significant media attention focused on the matchup between the Rams' quarterback Matthew Stafford and the Bengals' quarterback Joe Burrow. Both quarterbacks were considered among the top players in the league, and the game was seen as a showdown between two of the NFL's top offenses.

Entertainment
------------

### Pre-game ceremonies

The pre-game ceremonies for Super Bowl LVI were held on February 13, 2022, at SoFi Stadium. The ceremonies included a performance by the singer Mickey Guyton, who sang the national anthem. The coin toss was performed by Billie Jean King, a tennis legend and social activist.

### Halftime show

The halftime show for Super Bowl LVI was performed by a lineup of hip-hop and R&B artists, including Dr. Dre, Snoop Dogg, Eminem, Mary J. Blige, and Kendrick Lamar. The show was widely praised for its high energy and nostalgic value.

Broadcasting
------------

### United States

#### Television

The game was broadcast on television by NBC, with play-by-play announcer Al Michaels and color commentator Cris Collinsworth. The broadcast was seen by an estimated 112.3 million viewers, making it one of the most-watched television programs of all time.

#### Advertising

The advertising for Super Bowl LVI was highly anticipated, with many major brands paying millions of dollars for commercial time during the game. Some of the most notable ads included a spot for the cryptocurrency company Coinbase and a spot for the electric vehicle manufacturer General Motors.

#### Streaming

The game was also streamed online by NBC Sports, with an estimated 11.2 million viewers tuning in through the streaming platform.

#### Radio

The game was broadcast on radio by Westwood One, with play-by-play announcer Kevin Harlan and color commentator Kurt Warner.

#### Ratings and viewership

The game received a 41.6 household rating and a 77 share, making it one of the highest-rated television programs of all time.

### International

The game was broadcast internationally by a number of networks, including CTV in Canada and Sky Sports in the United Kingdom. The game was also streamed online by the NFL's international streaming platform, NFL Game Pass.

Game summary
------------

### First half

The first half of the game was marked by a defensive struggle, with both teams struggling to move the ball. The Rams scored the first points of the game on a field goal by kicker Matt Gay, but the Bengals responded with a touchdown pass from quarterback Joe Burrow to wide receiver Tee Higgins. The Rams responded with a touchdown pass from quarterback Matthew Stafford to wide receiver Cooper Kupp, but the Bengals responded with a field goal by kicker Evan McPherson. At halftime, the score was tied 13-13.

### Second half

The second half of the game was marked by a series of turnovers and momentum shifts. The Rams scored the first points of the half on a field goal by kicker Matt Gay, but the Bengals responded with a touchdown pass from quarterback Joe Burrow to wide receiver Ja'Marr Chase. The Rams responded with a touchdown pass from quarterback Matthew Stafford to wide receiver Cooper Kupp, but the Bengals responded with a field goal by kicker Evan McPherson. With just over a minute remaining in the game, the Rams drove down the field and scored the winning touchdown on a pass from quarterback Matthew Stafford to wide receiver Cooper Kupp.

2023 NBA Playoffs

The 2023 NBA playoffs were the postseason tournament of the National Basketball Association's 2022-23 season. The playoffs began on April 15, 2023, and concluded on June 12, 2023, with the Denver Nuggets defeating the Miami Heat in the NBA Finals.

# Overview

## Updates to postseason appearances

The 2023 playoffs saw several teams make their first postseason appearance in recent years. The New York Knicks made their first playoff appearance since 2013, while the Los Angeles Lakers returned to the playoffs after a one-year absence. The Sacramento Kings ended a 17-year playoff drought, the longest active drought in the NBA at the time.

## Notable occurrences

The 2023 playoffs were marked by several notable occurrences. In the first round, the Miami Heat became the first eighth seed to defeat a first seed in the Eastern Conference playoffs since 2012. In the Western Conference semifinals, the Golden State Warriors came back from a 3-1 deficit to defeat the Los Angeles Lakers. The NBA Finals saw the Denver Nuggets win their first championship in franchise history, led by Nikola Jokić's dominant performance.

article:
Faithful & District Football Association

The Faithful & District Football Association is a defunct Australian rules football competition based in the Faithful Creek area of Victoria, Australia. The league operated from 1913 to 1941 and was one of the prominent regional football competitions in the state during its time.

#History

The Faithful & District Football Association was formed in 1913, with five founding clubs: Faithful Creek, Longwood, Creighton's Creek, Murchison, and Rushworth. The league was established to provide a competitive platform for local football clubs in the Faithful Creek area. Over the years, the association underwent several changes, including the addition of new clubs, changes in the league's structure, and the introduction of new competitions.

During its early years, the association faced several challenges, including the impact of World War I on player numbers and the difficulty of securing suitable grounds for matches. However, the league persevered and continued to grow, with the addition of new clubs and the establishment of a junior competition.

In the 1920s and 1930s, the Faithful & District Football Association experienced a period of significant growth and success. The league attracted top players from around the region, and the standard of competition improved dramatically. The association also established a strong reputation for sportsmanship and fair play, with a focus on developing young players and promoting the values of the game.

Despite its success, the Faithful & District Football Association faced significant challenges during the 1930s, including the impact of the Great Depression on local communities and the loss of players to larger leagues. The association also struggled to maintain its competitiveness, with several clubs experiencing financial difficulties and player shortages.

In 1941, the Faithful & District Football Association merged with the nearby Euroa Football League to form the Euroa & District Football Association. The merger marked the end of the Faithful & District Football Association as a separate entity, although many of its clubs continued to compete in the new league.

#Football Clubs

The Faithful & District Football Association was home to several clubs during its existence, including:

The 2023 Cricket World Cup Qualifier is an international cricket tournament that took place in Zimbabwe from June 18 to July 9, 2023. The tournament served as the final qualifying event for the 2023 ICC Cricket World Cup, with the top two teams earning a spot in the main tournament. The qualifier featured 10 teams, including the bottom five teams from the 2019 ICC Cricket World Cup and the top five teams from the ICC World Cup Super League.

article:
Lists of feature films with LGBT characters

The depiction of LGBT characters in feature films has been a subject of interest for many years, with the representation of these characters varying greatly over time. The following lists aim to provide a comprehensive overview of feature films that include LGBT characters, covering a wide range of genres, styles, and time periods.

# Early years (1900s-1960s)

## Silent era

During the silent era, LGBT characters were often portrayed in a subtle and coded manner, due to the social and cultural norms of the time. Films such as "A Florida Enchantment" (1914) and "Pandora's Box" (1929) featured characters with same-sex attractions, but these were often depicted in a way that was not overtly explicit.

## Pre-Code era

The pre-Code era saw a slight increase in the representation of LGBT characters, with films such as "Call Her Savage" (1932) and "Design for Living" (1933) featuring characters with same-sex relationships. However, these depictions were often subject to censorship and were not always explicit.

## Post-Code era

The post-Code era saw a significant decline in the representation of LGBT characters, as the Hays Code prohibited the depiction of "sex perversion" on screen. Films such as "Rebel Without a Cause" (1955) and "Tea and Sympathy" (1956) featured characters with same-sex attractions, but these were often depicted in a way that was subtle and coded.

# New Wave and counterculture (1960s-1970s)

## European art house

The European art house movement saw a significant increase in the representation of LGBT characters, with films such as "The Servant" (1963) and "The Damned" (1969) featuring characters with same-sex relationships. These films often explored themes of identity, alienation, and social critique.

## American underground

The American underground movement saw the emergence of films such as "Scorpio Rising" (1964) and "Flesh" (1968), which featured explicit depictions of same-sex relationships and explored themes of identity, desire, and rebellion.

## Mainstream cinema

The mainstream cinema of the 1960s and 1970s saw a gradual increase in the representation of LGBT characters, with films such as "The Boys in the Band" (1970) and "Sunday Bloody Sunday" (1971) featuring characters with same-sex relationships. These films often explored themes of identity, community, and social critique.

# AIDS epidemic and queer cinema (1980s-1990s)

## AIDS epidemic

The AIDS epidemic had a significant impact on the representation of LGBT characters in film, with films such as "Parting Glances" (1986) and "Longtime Companion" (1989) exploring themes of identity, community, and mortality.

## Queer cinema

The queer cinema movement saw the emergence of films such as "Desert Hearts" (1985) and "My Own Private Idaho" (1991), which featured explicit depictions of same-sex relationships and explored themes of identity, desire, and rebellion.

## Mainstream cinema

The mainstream cinema of the 1980s and 1990s saw a gradual increase in the representation of LGBT characters, with films such as "Philadelphia" (1993) and "The Birdcage" (1996) featuring characters with same-sex relationships. These films often explored themes of identity, community, and social critique.

# Contemporary cinema (2000s-present)

## LGBTQ+ cinema

The LGBTQ+ cinema movement has seen the emergence of films such as "Brokeback Mountain" (2005) and "Moonlight" (2016), which feature explicit depictions of same-sex relationships and explore themes of identity, desire, and rebellion.

## Mainstream cinema

The mainstream cinema of the 2000s and 2010s has seen a significant increase in the representation of LGBT characters, with films such as "The Kids Are All Right" (2010) and "Love, Simon" (2018) featuring characters with same-sex relationships. These films often explore themes of identity, community, and social critique.

## Trans representation

The representation of trans characters in film has seen a significant increase in recent years, with films such as "Transamerica" (2005) and "The Danish Girl" (2015) featuring trans characters and exploring themes of identity, community, and social critique.

article:
United States at the 2022 Winter Olympics

The United States competed at the 2022 Winter Olympics in Beijing, China, from February 4 to 20, 2022. The United States Olympic Committee (USOC) sent a total of 224 athletes to the Games, competing in 15 sports.

# Medalists

The United States won a total of 25 medals, including 8 gold, 10 silver, and 7 bronze. The American team finished fifth in the overall medal count, behind Norway, Germany, Canada, and China.

# Competitors

The United States sent 224 athletes to the 2022 Winter Olympics, with 115 men and 109 women competing in 15 sports. The team was led by flagbearer Erin Jackson, a speed skater, at the opening ceremony.

# Alpine Skiing

The United States alpine skiing team consisted of 17 athletes, with 9 men and 8 women competing in 11 events. Mikaela Shiffrin, a two-time Olympic gold medalist, led the team and finished 9th in the women's slalom. Ryan Cochran-Siegle won the silver medal in the men's super-G, while Alexander Schmid finished 5th in the men's giant slalom.

# Biathlon

The United States biathlon team consisted of 9 athletes, with 4 men and 5 women competing in 11 events. Susan Dunklee finished 27th in the women's sprint, while Clare Egan finished 26th in the women's pursuit. Sean Doherty finished 25th in the men's sprint, while Leif Nordgren finished 23rd in the men's pursuit.

# Bobsleigh (Bobsled)

The United States bobsleigh team consisted of 12 athletes, with 8 men and 4 women competing in 4 events. The team won two medals, with Kaillie Humphries and Elana Meyers Taylor finishing 1st and 2nd in the women's monobob. The men's four-man team, led by Hunter Church, finished 10th.

# Cross-Country Skiing

The United States cross-country skiing team consisted of 14 athletes, with 8 men and 6 women competing in 12 events. Jessie Diggins finished 6th in the women's sprint, while Rosie Brennan finished 5th in the women's 10km. Ben Ogden finished 12th in the men's sprint, while Gus Schumacher finished 11th in the men's 15km.

# Curling

The United States curling team consisted of 10 athletes, with 5 men and 5 women competing in 3 events.

## Men's Tournament

The United States men's curling team, led by John Shuster, finished 4th in the round-robin stage with a 5-4 record. The team lost to Canada in the semifinals, 8-5, and then lost to Canada again in the bronze medal game, 8-4.

## Women's Tournament

The United States women's curling team, led by Tabitha Peterson, finished 3rd in the round-robin stage with a 6-3 record. The team lost to Japan in the semifinals, 10-7, and then won the bronze medal against Canada, 8-4.

## Mixed Doubles Tournament

The United States mixed doubles curling team, consisting of Vicky Persinger and Chris Plys, finished 8th in the round-robin stage with a 3-6 record. The team failed to advance to the playoffs.

# Figure Skating

The United States figure skating team consisted of 16 athletes, with 8 men and 8 women competing in 5 events. Nathan Chen won the gold medal in the men's singles, while Vincent Zhou finished 3rd in the men's singles. Madison Hubbell and Zachary Donohue finished 3rd in the ice dance.

# Freestyle Skiing

The United States freestyle skiing team consisted of 28 athletes, with 15 men and 13 women competing in 13 events. The team won 4 medals, with Ashley Caldwell winning the gold medal in the women's aerials. Colby Stevenson won the silver medal in the men's big air, while Megan Smallhouse finished 3rd in the women's ski cross.

# Ice Hockey
